title: Pulmonary hypertension
summary: Pulmonary hypertension (PH or PHTN) is a condition of increased blood pressure within the arteries of the lungs.[7] Symptoms include shortness of breath, fainting, tiredness, chest pain, swelling of the legs, and a fast heartbeat.[7][2] The condition may make it difficult to exercise.[7] Onset is typically gradual.[8]
